item.title: Windows Server end-of-support (EOS): Upgrade seamlessly with Azure Migrate (Public preview)
item.description: With Azure Migrate, seamlessly upgrade legacy Windows servers while migrating to Azure, minimizing effort, downtime, and risk. By creating a copy of the server in Azure and performing the upgrade there, the impact on the original server is minimized, ensuring a secure and efficient transition.
item.atom:content: With Azure Migrate, seamlessly upgrade legacy Windows servers while migrating to Azure, minimizing effort, downtime, and risk. By creating a copy of the server in Azure and performing the upgrade there, the impact on the original server is minimized, ensuring a secure and efficient transition.

item.title: Preview: Azure Boost
item.description: Azure Boost is one of Microsoft Azure’s latest and most significant infrastructure innovations, enabling greater network and storage performance at scale, improves security, and reduced servicing impact.
item.atom:content: Azure Boost is one of Microsoft Azure’s latest and most significant infrastructure innovations, enabling greater network and storage performance at scale, improves security, and reduced servicing impact.

item.title: Public preview: Bring your own key on Ephemeral OS disk for AKS
item.description: You can now use your own keys to encrypt your ephemeral OS disks.
item.atom:content: You can now use your own keys to encrypt your ephemeral OS disks.

item.title: Public preview: Network observability add-on for AKS
item.description: You can now get complete observability into the network health and connectivity of your AKS cluster.
item.atom:content: You can now get complete observability into the network health and connectivity of your AKS cluster.

item.title: Public preview: Support for Python 3.11 in Azure Functions
item.description: Take advantage of Python 3.11 features with Azure Functions
item.atom:content: Take advantage of Python 3.11 features with Azure Functions

item.title: Public Preview: OData API type in Azure API Management
item.description: We are excited to announce the public preview of the OData API type in Azure API Management. This new capability extends the benefits and capabilities of Azure API Management to OData APIs, including the ability to secure them with standard API protections, such as authentication, authorization, and rate limiting, in combination with OData-specific policies for request validation.
item.atom:content: We are excited to announce the public preview of the OData API type in Azure API Management. This new capability extends the benefits and capabilities of Azure API Management to OData APIs, including the ability to secure them with standard API protections, such as authentication, authorization, and rate limiting, in combination with OData-specific policies for request validation.

item.title: Generally available: Event Grid upgrade enhancements for AKS
item.description: You can now receive and programmatically handle AKS generated upgrade events in Event Grid
item.atom:content: You can now receive and programmatically handle AKS generated upgrade events in Event Grid

item.title: Azure Machine Learning - Public Preview for July
item.description: New features now available in Public Preview enable you to create AI workflows that connect to various language models and data sources and use prompt flow and Azure OpenAI models to build LLM applications.
item.atom:content: New features now available in Public Preview enable you to create AI workflows that connect to various language models and data sources and use prompt flow and Azure OpenAI models to build LLM applications.

item.title: Azure Machine Learning - General Availability for July
item.description: A new feature now available in GA enables you to create compute clusters in locations that are different from the location of the workspace.
item.atom:content: A new feature now available in GA enables you to create compute clusters in locations that are different from the location of the workspace.

item.title: General availability: IoT Hub Service Upgrade
item.description: All IoT Hubs will be going through a service upgrade between July 2023 and November 2023 with potential impact to your IoT Hub.
item.atom:content: All IoT Hubs will be going through a service upgrade between July 2023 and November 2023 with potential impact to your IoT Hub.

item.title: Public Preview : Crash Consistent VM Restore points
item.description: For Azure partners and customers seeking to develop business continuity and disaster recovery solutions, crash-consistent VM restore points serve as feature-rich building blocks, offering an agentless solution available natively on the Azure platform.
item.atom:content: For Azure partners and customers seeking to develop business continuity and disaster recovery solutions, crash-consistent VM restore points serve as feature-rich building blocks, offering an agentless solution available natively on the Azure platform.

item.title: New Extended Security Updates (ESUs) enabled by Azure Arc
item.description: At Inspire, we are announcing Extended Security Updates (ESUs) enabled by Azure Arc. Customers will be able to purchase and seamlessly deploy ESUs through Azure Arc in on-premises or multicloud environments, right from the Azure portal.
item.atom:content: At Inspire, we are announcing Extended Security Updates (ESUs) enabled by Azure Arc. Customers will be able to purchase and seamlessly deploy ESUs through Azure Arc in on-premises or multicloud environments, right from the Azure portal.

item.title: Public Preview: Vector search, a feature of Azure Cognitive Search
item.description: With Vector search, Developers can store, index, and deliver search applications over vector representations of organizational data including text, images, audio, video, and more.
item.atom:content: With Vector search, Developers can store, index, and deliver search applications over vector representations of organizational data including text, images, audio, video, and more.

item.title: Hotpatch is now generally available on Windows Server VMs on Azure with the Desktop Experience installation mode
item.description: Hotpatch is now available for Windows Server Azure Edition VMs using the newly released images. Hotpatch is a feature that allows you to patch and install OS security updates to Windows Server Azure Edition VMs on Azure without requiring a reboot!
item.atom:content: Hotpatch is now available for Windows Server Azure Edition VMs using the newly released images. Hotpatch is a feature that allows you to patch and install OS security updates to Windows Server Azure Edition VMs on Azure without requiring a reboot!

item.title: General availability: Always Serve for Azure Traffic Manager
item.description: Always Serve feature for Azure Traffic Manager (ATM) is now generally available. This feature allows you to disable endpoint health checks from an ATM profile and always serve traffic to that given endpoint.
item.atom:content: Always Serve feature for Azure Traffic Manager (ATM) is now generally available. This feature allows you to disable endpoint health checks from an ATM profile and always serve traffic to that given endpoint.

item.title: Public preview: Stream Analytics No-Code Editor available in Azure Stream Analytics Portal
item.description: The no-code editor is now available in Azure Stream Analytics portal to enable building your Stream Analytics jobs effortlessly, no coding required.
item.atom:content: The no-code editor is now available in Azure Stream Analytics portal to enable building your Stream Analytics jobs effortlessly, no coding required.

item.title: Retirement notice: Azure Media Services is being retired on 30 June 2024
item.description: Azure Media Services will be retired on 30 June 2024 - transition to a Microsoft partner solution or Azure Video Indexer
item.atom:content: Azure Media Services will be retired on 30 June 2024 - transition to a Microsoft partner solution or Azure Video Indexer

item.title: Generally available: Autoscale Stream Analytics jobs
item.description: Generally available: Autoscale Stream Analytics jobs
item.atom:content: Generally available: Autoscale Stream Analytics jobs

item.title: Public Preview: Azure Dedicated Host - Resize
item.description: Introducing resize capability for Azure dedicated hosts
item.atom:content: Introducing resize capability for Azure dedicated hosts

item.title: Microsoft Dev Box is now generally available
item.description: Microsoft Dev Box is generally available now. Dev Box is a virtualized solution that empowers developers to quickly spin up self-service workstations preconfigured for their tasks while maintaining centralized management to maximize security and compliance.
item.atom:content: Microsoft Dev Box is generally available now. Dev Box is a virtualized solution that empowers developers to quickly spin up self-service workstations preconfigured for their tasks while maintaining centralized management to maximize security and compliance.

item.title: General availability: ExpressRoute private peering support for BGP communities
item.description: Set BGP community tags on traffic sent from Azure to on-premises over ExpressRoute, enabling a greater variety of hybrid network designs.
item.atom:content: Set BGP community tags on traffic sent from Azure to on-premises over ExpressRoute, enabling a greater variety of hybrid network designs.

item.category: Azure Communication Services; CPaaS; Calling; Apps; PSTN; VoIP
item.title: General availability: Call automation capabilities for Azure Communication Services
item.description: A new set of APIs are in preview, to help developers build server-based, calling workflows.
item.atom:content: A new set of APIs are in preview, to help developers build server-based, calling workflows.

item.title: Datadog – An Azure Native ISV Service – the most desired new features now available
item.description: Explore new capabilities with Datadog – An Azure Native ISV Service, that include a scalable solution to monitor resources in multiple subscriptions, configuration for Cloud Security Posture Management and ability to mute the monitor for expected VM shutdowns.
item.atom:content: Explore new capabilities with Datadog – An Azure Native ISV Service, that include a scalable solution to monitor resources in multiple subscriptions, configuration for Cloud Security Posture Management and ability to mute the monitor for expected VM shutdowns.

item.title: Public preview: Latest generation burstable VMs - Bsv2, Basv2, and Bpsv2
item.description: The new second generation burstable VMs provide the lowest cost of entry to the Azure VM portfolio with greater performance.
item.atom:content: The new second generation burstable VMs provide the lowest cost of entry to the Azure VM portfolio with greater performance.

item.title: Azure AD is becoming Microsoft Entra ID
item.description: Microsoft Entra ID is the new name for Azure Active Directory (Azure AD). No action is required from you.
item.atom:content: Microsoft Entra ID is the new name for Azure Active Directory (Azure AD). No action is required from you.

item.title: Azure SQL—General availability updates for early July 2023
item.description: General availability enhancements and updates released for Azure SQL in early July 2023.
item.atom:content: General availability enhancements and updates released for Azure SQL in early July 2023.

item.title: Azure Managed Lustre now generally available
item.description: Reduce infrastructure setup with a managed file system optimized for HPC and AI workloads.
item.atom:content: Reduce infrastructure setup with a managed file system optimized for HPC and AI workloads.

item.title: Generally available: Azure Digital Twins supports Digital Twins Definition Language version 3
item.description: ADT supports defining models using the Digital Twins Definition Language version 3 (DTDL v3)
item.atom:content: ADT supports defining models using the Digital Twins Definition Language version 3 (DTDL v3)

item.title: Azure’s cross-region Load Balancer is now generally available
item.description: Azure Load Balancer support for cross-region load balancing is now generally available. You can now load balance across Azure regions enabling a globally redundant architecture via Azure Load Balancer.
item.atom:content: Azure Load Balancer support for cross-region load balancing is now generally available. You can now load balance across Azure regions enabling a globally redundant architecture via Azure Load Balancer.

item.title: General availability: Azure Data Explorer adds support for PostgreSQL, MySQL, and CosmosDB SQL external tables
item.description: Azure Data Explorer has released three new types of external tables: PostgrSQL, MySQL, and CosmosDB SQL. These new external tables allow users to query data from these sources directly within Azure Data Explorer using the Kusto Query Language (KQL).
item.atom:content: Azure Data Explorer has released three new types of external tables: PostgrSQL, MySQL, and CosmosDB SQL. These new external tables allow users to query data from these sources directly within Azure Data Explorer using the Kusto Query Language (KQL).

item.title: Public preview: Azure Virtual Network encryption
item.description: Azure Virtual Network encryption allows you to seamlessly encrypt and decrypt traffic between Azure Virtual Machines.
item.atom:content: Azure Virtual Network encryption allows you to seamlessly encrypt and decrypt traffic between Azure Virtual Machines.

item.title: Azure Service Fabric 9.0 Tenth Refresh Release
item.description: This release includes bug fixes and quality improvements.
item.atom:content: This release includes bug fixes and quality improvements.

item.description: This release includes bug fixes and quality improvements.
item.atom:content: This release includes bug fixes and quality improvements.

item.title: Generally available: Azure Premium SSD v2 Disk Storage is now available in more regions.
item.description: Azure Premium SSD v2 Disk Storage is now available in more regions and offers the most advanced general-purpose block storage solution with the best price performance.
item.atom:content: Azure Premium SSD v2 Disk Storage is now available in more regions and offers the most advanced general-purpose block storage solution with the best price performance.

item.title: Public Preview: Ingest events from Azure Event Hubs to Azure Monitor Logs
item.description: You can now ingest data directly from an event hub into a Log Analytics workspace
item.atom:content: You can now ingest data directly from an event hub into a Log Analytics workspace

item.title: Public Preview: Azure Monitor Pod Sandboxing support in Container insights
item.description: Container Insights supports monitoring pod sandboxed containers. Pod Sandboxing safeguards against “Container Breakout” scenarios such as a malicious or legitimate user escaping container isolation to access host machine resources.
item.atom:content: Container Insights supports monitoring pod sandboxed containers. Pod Sandboxing safeguards against “Container Breakout” scenarios such as a malicious or legitimate user escaping container isolation to access host machine resources.

item.title: Public preview: Managed private endpoint for Azure Managed Grafana
item.description: Managed private endpoint in Azure Managed Grafana enables a customer to connect their Grafana workspace privately to supported Azure data sources. It is simple to configure and manage.
item.atom:content: Managed private endpoint in Azure Managed Grafana enables a customer to connect their Grafana workspace privately to supported Azure data sources. It is simple to configure and manage.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure Monitor Logs improved table-level RBAC
item.description: Today we announce an improvement to the table-level RBAC used to assign permissions to specific tables
item.atom:content: Today we announce an improvement to the table-level RBAC used to assign permissions to specific tables

item.title: Public preview: Azure Monitor application insights configurable Real User Monitoring for Java
item.description: The new “browserSdkLoader” configuration in the Azure Monitor OpenTelemetry Java Distro makes it easier than ever to enable Real User Monitoring (RUM) in Application Insights.
item.atom:content: The new “browserSdkLoader” configuration in the Azure Monitor OpenTelemetry Java Distro makes it easier than ever to enable Real User Monitoring (RUM) in Application Insights.

item.title: Public preview: Azure Monitor Agent Health experience
item.description: The Azure Monitor Agent Health experience is now available in preview. Identify data collection problems across your organization before they start impacting your business.
item.atom:content: The Azure Monitor Agent Health experience is now available in preview. Identify data collection problems across your organization before they start impacting your business.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure Monitor Agent supports VM Insights in Azure Government Cloud
item.description: Azure Government Cloud customers can now enable VM Insights via the new Azure Monitor Agent, to monitor the client workload on the VMs or VMSS.
item.atom:content: Azure Government Cloud customers can now enable VM Insights via the new Azure Monitor Agent, to monitor the client workload on the VMs or VMSS.

item.title: Public preview: Sensitive Data Protection for Application Gateway Web Application Firewall logs
item.description: Protect the sensitive data getting stored in your Web Application Firewall (WAF) logs using log scrubbing on Azure’s regional Web Application Firewall running on Application Gateway.
item.atom:content: Protect the sensitive data getting stored in your Web Application Firewall (WAF) logs using log scrubbing on Azure’s regional Web Application Firewall running on Application Gateway.

item.title: General Availability: Azure Native New Relic Service
item.description: Enable full stack cloud monitoring and leverage rich deep integration capabilities between Azure and New Relic, with Azure Native New Relic Service now generally available.
item.atom:content: Enable full stack cloud monitoring and leverage rich deep integration capabilities between Azure and New Relic, with Azure Native New Relic Service now generally available.

item.title: General availability: Azure Archive Storage now available in Sweden Central
item.description: Reduce spending by storing rarely accessed data to Azure Archive Storage, now in new regions.
item.atom:content: Reduce spending by storing rarely accessed data to Azure Archive Storage, now in new regions.

item.title: Public Preview: Default Rule Set 2.1 for Regional WAF with Application Gateway
item.description: Increase your security posture and reduce false positives with Default Rule Set 2.1, now in preview on Azure's regional Web Application Firewall (WAF) with Application Gateway.
item.atom:content: Increase your security posture and reduce false positives with Default Rule Set 2.1, now in preview on Azure's regional Web Application Firewall (WAF) with Application Gateway.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure OpenAI Service On Your Data
item.description: Introducing Azure OpenAI Service on your data in public preview, which unlocks the power of OpenAI models like ChatGPT and GPT-4 with your own data. It streamlines communication, enhances customer service, boosts productivity without training, provides access to specific data sources for accurate insights, and enables seamless data connectivity, web app deployment, and transformative conversational AI experiences.
item.atom:content: Introducing Azure OpenAI Service on your data in public preview, which unlocks the power of OpenAI models like ChatGPT and GPT-4 with your own data. It streamlines communication, enhances customer service, boosts productivity without training, provides access to specific data sources for accurate insights, and enables seamless data connectivity, web app deployment, and transformative conversational AI experiences.

item.title: Preview Updates: Azure Elastic SAN Public Preview improvements
item.description: Introducing the latest update to Azure Elastic SAN (in preview), which now offers expanded range of regions, increased support for diverse workloads, and an array of new features.
item.atom:content: Introducing the latest update to Azure Elastic SAN (in preview), which now offers expanded range of regions, increased support for diverse workloads, and an array of new features.

item.atom:content: Easily manage public-facing and private-facing traffic on a common port.

item.title: General availability: Introducing DropMappedField transformation for data mappings in Azure Data Explorer
item.description: Azure Data Explorer has added a new capability called "DropMappedField" to its data mappings. This feature allows users to map an object in a JSON document to a column while removing any nested fields that are already referenced by other column mappings.
item.atom:content: Azure Data Explorer has added a new capability called "DropMappedField" to its data mappings. This feature allows users to map an object in a JSON document to a column while removing any nested fields that are already referenced by other column mappings.

item.title: Generally available: Zone Redundant Storage for Azure Disks is now available in Japan East and Korea Central
item.description: Zone Redundant Storage (ZRS) for Azure Disks is now available on Azure Premium SSD and Standard SSD in Japan East and Korea Central.
item.atom:content: Zone Redundant Storage (ZRS) for Azure Disks is now available on Azure Premium SSD and Standard SSD in Japan East and Korea Central.

item.title: Generally Available: Azure Monitor Alert resources now visible in the Azure portal
item.description: Alert rules, alert processing rules and action groups can now be viewed in the portal alongside all Azure resources.
item.atom:content: Alert rules, alert processing rules and action groups can now be viewed in the portal alongside all Azure resources.

item.title: Microsoft Azure Load Testing supports setting up quick start tests using requests per second
item.description: You can now set up a 'quick test' to check that your endpoint can handle a certain throughput of requests per second (RPS).
item.atom:content: You can now set up a 'quick test' to check that your endpoint can handle a certain throughput of requests per second (RPS).

item.title: General availability: Azure Cache for Redis with Web App Marketplace offer
item.description: Create an Azure Cache for Redis instance in the Web App and database Azure Marketplace offer to accelerate your web application performance.
item.atom:content: Create an Azure Cache for Redis instance in the Web App and database Azure Marketplace offer to accelerate your web application performance.

item.title: Public Preview: Redis extension for Azure Functions
item.description: You can now leverage Redis data types as triggers for serverless app development.
item.atom:content: You can now leverage Redis data types as triggers for serverless app development.

item.title: New Instance Types for Azure Red Hat OpenShift are now available
item.description: You now have more virtual machine sizes to choose from in Azure Red Hat OpenShift.
item.atom:content: You now have more virtual machine sizes to choose from in Azure Red Hat OpenShift.

item.title: General availability: 32 TB storage in Azure Database for PostgreSQL - Flexible Server
item.description: Extend storage up to 32 TB to host databases with a size greater than 16 TB for Azure Database for PostgreSQL – Flexible Server.
item.atom:content: Extend storage up to 32 TB to host databases with a size greater than 16 TB for Azure Database for PostgreSQL – Flexible Server.

item.title: Available: Reduced pricing for Azure Video Indexer
item.description: Azure Video indexer will be adding Advanced Audio and Video SKUs for Advanced presets and a 40% price reduction on the Basic Audio Analysis, Audio Analysis and Video Analysis SKUs.
item.atom:content: Azure Video indexer will be adding Advanced Audio and Video SKUs for Advanced presets and a 40% price reduction on the Basic Audio Analysis, Audio Analysis and Video Analysis SKUs.

item.title: Azure Machine Learning - June 2023 PuPr Announcement - View status of jobs in Azure Pipelines
item.description: New feature now available in Public Preview enables you to view job statuses without unnecessary compute cost accrual.
item.atom:content: New feature now available in Public Preview enables you to view job statuses without unnecessary compute cost accrual.

item.title: General availability of Azure Front Door integration with managed identities
item.description: Azure Front Door supports using managed identity to access Key Vault without the need to generate, store, and rotate secrets. This is a secure service to service authentication method to enhance security.
item.atom:content: Azure Front Door supports using managed identity to access Key Vault without the need to generate, store, and rotate secrets. This is a secure service to service authentication method to enhance security.

item.title: Generally available: Azure OpenAI Service in UK South
item.description: Azure OpenAI Service is now available in the UK South region. UK South supports gpt-35-turbo at launch.
item.atom:content: Azure OpenAI Service is now available in the UK South region. UK South supports gpt-35-turbo at launch.

item.title: General availability: Azure Sphere version 23.05 is delayed to 20 June, and the updated OS has been issued to Retail Eval
item.description: Participate in the retail evaluation now to ensure full compatibility. The OS evaluation period provides seven days for backward compatibility testing.
item.atom:content: Participate in the retail evaluation now to ensure full compatibility. The OS evaluation period provides seven days for backward compatibility testing.

item.title: General availability: Azure Front Door Migration from classic to standard/premium
item.description: Azure Front Door Standard/Premium is the new Azure native, modern cloud content delivery network (CDN) catering to both dynamic and static content delivery acceleration with enhanced security and a simple and predictable pricing model.
item.atom:content: Azure Front Door Standard/Premium is the new Azure native, modern cloud content delivery network (CDN) catering to both dynamic and static content delivery acceleration with enhanced security and a simple and predictable pricing model.

item.title: General availability: Azure Front Door upgrade from standard to premium
item.description: Upgrade from standard to premium for enhanced Web Application Firewall rules and private connectivity to your origins using Private Link.
item.atom:content: Upgrade from standard to premium for enhanced Web Application Firewall rules and private connectivity to your origins using Private Link.

item.title: General availability: Inbound ICMPv6 pings and traceroute are now supported on Azure Load Balancer
item.description: Ping and traceroute to both IPv4 and IPv6 frontend of a Standard Public Load Balancer like you natively would on an on-premises device without any external software needed.
item.atom:content: Ping and traceroute to both IPv4 and IPv6 frontend of a Standard Public Load Balancer like you natively would on an on-premises device without any external software needed.

item.title: Public preview: Azure Front Door Standard/Premium in Azure Government
item.description: Azure Front Door Standard/Premium is the new Azure native, modern cloud content delivery network (CDN) catering to both dynamic and static content delivery acceleration with enhanced security and a simple and predictable pricing model.
item.atom:content: Azure Front Door Standard/Premium is the new Azure native, modern cloud content delivery network (CDN) catering to both dynamic and static content delivery acceleration with enhanced security and a simple and predictable pricing model.

item.title: Announcing the new Azure Container Registry libraries
item.description: We’re pleased to announce that version 1.1.0 of the Azure Container Registry (ACR) libraries for .NET, Java, JavaScript/TypeScript, and Python are now generally available.
item.atom:content: We’re pleased to announce that version 1.1.0 of the Azure Container Registry (ACR) libraries for .NET, Java, JavaScript/TypeScript, and Python are now generally available.

item.title: Public preview: Azure Container Instances(ACI) Spot containers
item.description: You can now take advantage of unused Azure computing with Azure Container Instances (ACI)
item.atom:content: You can now take advantage of unused Azure computing with Azure Container Instances (ACI)

item.title: Public Preview: Azure AD Support for Azure Files SMB shares REST API
item.description: With this announcement, cloud native and modern applications that use REST APIs to access Azure SMB shares can utilize identity-based authentication and authorization to access file shares.
item.atom:content: With this announcement, cloud native and modern applications that use REST APIs to access Azure SMB shares can utilize identity-based authentication and authorization to access file shares.

item.title: Generally available: Private Link support for Application Gateway
item.description: Application Gateway Private Link allows you to connect your workloads over a private connection spanning across VNets and subscriptions
item.atom:content: Application Gateway Private Link allows you to connect your workloads over a private connection spanning across VNets and subscriptions

item.title: Generally available: Multiple backups per day for Azure Virtual Machines
item.description: Protect Azure Virtual Machines with Recovery Point Objective (RPO) as low as four hours.
item.atom:content: Protect Azure Virtual Machines with Recovery Point Objective (RPO) as low as four hours.

item.title: General availability: New KQL function to enrich your data analysis with geographic context
item.description: KQL introduces a new function to retrieve country, state, city, and coordinates from IP addresses using GeoLite2 data. Find out how to use geo_info_from_ip_address() and what it can do for your data analysis.
item.atom:content: KQL introduces a new function to retrieve country, state, city, and coordinates from IP addresses using GeoLite2 data. Find out how to use geo_info_from_ip_address() and what it can do for your data analysis.

item.title: Generally available: Azure Data Explorer Kusto Emulator on Linux
item.description: The Kusto Emulator is now available as a Linux Docker Container!
item.atom:content: The Kusto Emulator is now available as a Linux Docker Container!

item.title: Public Preview: Azure Chaos Studio is now available in West US 2 region
item.description: Azure Chaos Studio is now available in West US 2 region.
item.atom:content: Azure Chaos Studio is now available in West US 2 region.

item.title: Public preview: Introducing NGads V620-series VMs optimized for cloud gaming
item.description: VGads V620-series virtual machines (VMs), now in public preview in the East US2, Europe west, and West US3 regions, enable service providers to build differentiated cloud gaming experiences.
item.atom:content: VGads V620-series virtual machines (VMs), now in public preview in the East US2, Europe west, and West US3 regions, enable service providers to build differentiated cloud gaming experiences.

item.title: General Availability: Isovalent Cilium Enterprise through Azure Marketplace
item.description: Isovalent Cilium Enterprise is now generally available through Azure Marketplace.
item.atom:content: Isovalent Cilium Enterprise is now generally available through Azure Marketplace.

item.title: Generally available: Jobs API to support bulk import in Azure Digital Twins
item.description: GA release for bulk import support for Azure Digital Twins
item.atom:content: GA release for bulk import support for Azure Digital Twins

item.title: Generally available: 8TB memory Mv2 Virtual Machine
item.description: Mv2 8TB Memory virtual machine is generally available now for your in-memory workloads.
item.atom:content: Mv2 8TB Memory virtual machine is generally available now for your in-memory workloads.

item.title: General availability: Azure Load Balancer per VM limit removal
item.description: Increase resiliency, higher availability, and flexibility by utilizing more than 2 Standard Load Balancers per VM.
item.atom:content: Increase resiliency, higher availability, and flexibility by utilizing more than 2 Standard Load Balancers per VM.

item.title: Azure Support Plan Offer extended to December 31, 2023
item.description: The existing Azure Support offer is being extended. The promotion will run from July 1, 2023 to December 31, 2023.
item.atom:content: The existing Azure Support offer is being extended. The promotion will run from July 1, 2023 to December 31, 2023.

item.title: Generally available: Azure Files scalability improvement for Azure Virtual Desktop and other workloads that open root directory handles
item.description: Azure Files has increased the root directory handle limit per share from 2,000 to 10,000 for standard and premium file shares.
item.atom:content: Azure Files has increased the root directory handle limit per share from 2,000 to 10,000 for standard and premium file shares.

item.title: Now Available: Resource-centric log queries in the Azure Monitor Query libraries
item.description: Resource-centric log query support is available in the latest stable release of the Azure Monitor Query client libraries. Query logs by Azure resource ID using .NET, Go, Java, JavaScript, or Python.
item.atom:content: Resource-centric log query support is available in the latest stable release of the Azure Monitor Query client libraries. Query logs by Azure resource ID using .NET, Go, Java, JavaScript, or Python.

item.title: Generally available: Zone Redundant Storage for Azure Disks is now available in more regions.

item.atom:content: Zone Redundant Storage (ZRS) for Azure Disks is now available on Azure Premium SSD and Standard SSD in Brazil South, UK South, East US, East US 2, and South-Central US.

item.title: General availability: Azure Sphere version 23.05 is delayed, new OS will be issued to Retail Eval
item.description: Participate in the retail evaluation now to ensure full compatibility. The OS evaluation period provides 14 days for backward compatibility testing.
item.atom:content: Participate in the retail evaluation now to ensure full compatibility. The OS evaluation period provides 14 days for backward compatibility testing.

item.title: General availability: NLog Sink for Azure Data Explorer
item.description: Azure Data Explorer now supports ingestion of data from .NET Applications via the NLog Sink.
item.atom:content: Azure Data Explorer now supports ingestion of data from .NET Applications via the NLog Sink.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure Data Explorer bindings for Azure Functions
item.description: Azure Data Explorer Bindings for Azure Functions (Public Preview)
item.atom:content: Azure Data Explorer Bindings for Azure Functions (Public Preview)

item.title: General availability: Azure CNI powered by Cilium
item.description: Leverage next generation eBPF dataplane for pod networking, Kubernetes network policies and service load balancing.
item.atom:content: Leverage next generation eBPF dataplane for pod networking, Kubernetes network policies and service load balancing.

item.title: Setting Up a CI/CD Pipeline with GitHub Actions for Stream Analytics Jobs
item.description: Are you using GitHub for managing your Stream Analytics project and looking to leverage GitHub's powerful CI/CD pipeline? Follow this comprehensive guide and learn to set up a CI/CD pipeline with GitHub Actions for your Stream Analytics jobs.
item.atom:content: Are you using GitHub for managing your Stream Analytics project and looking to leverage GitHub's powerful CI/CD pipeline? Follow this comprehensive guide and learn to set up a CI/CD pipeline with GitHub Actions for your Stream Analytics jobs.

item.title: Public Preview – Support for WebSocket APIs in Azure API Management Self-hosted Gateway
item.description: We are announcing the native support for WebSocket APIs in the self-hosted gateway feature inside Azure API Management.
item.atom:content: We are announcing the native support for WebSocket APIs in the self-hosted gateway feature inside Azure API Management.

item.title: Public Preview: Data mapping designer in Azure Logic Apps (Standard)
item.description: Microsoft has re-envisioned data transformations in Azure Logic Apps (Standard) by building a new data mapper experience from the ground up.
item.atom:content: Microsoft has re-envisioned data transformations in Azure Logic Apps (Standard) by building a new data mapper experience from the ground up.

item.title: PublicPreview: Azure API Management: API Center
item.description:
Centrally organize and manage APIs across the entire organization, regardless of API type, deployment location, lifecycle stage, or choice of API gateway or API management solution using Azure API Center.
Boost developer productivity by facilitating API discovery and promoting API reuse. Establish a governance model for API portfolio across the entire organization. Elevate API inventory management by organizing and enriching APIs with custom metadata, API versions, and deployment details. Click here to learn more.
item.atom:content:
Centrally organize and manage APIs across the entire organization, regardless of API type, deployment location, lifecycle stage, or choice of API gateway or API management solution using Azure API Center.
Boost developer productivity by facilitating API discovery and promoting API reuse. Establish a governance model for API portfolio across the entire organization. Elevate API inventory management by organizing and enriching APIs with custom metadata, API versions, and deployment details. Click here to learn more.

item.title: GA: Logic Apps (Standard) adds support for .NET Framework extensibility in XSLT data.
item.description: Developers can now add .NET Framework methods to XSLT data transformations in Azure Logic Apps (Standard).
item.atom:content: Developers can now add .NET Framework methods to XSLT data transformations in Azure Logic Apps (Standard).

item.title: Generally available: Apache MirrorMaker 2 support in Azure Event Hubs
item.description: Users now can utilize MirrorMaker2 for effortless data replication from their on-premises or managed Kafka cluster directly to Event Hubs.
item.atom:content: Users now can utilize MirrorMaker2 for effortless data replication from their on-premises or managed Kafka cluster directly to Event Hubs.

item.title: Public Preview: JSON Schema support in Azure Event Hubs Schema Registry for Kafka applications
item.description: The Azure Event Hubs Schema Registry provides support for JSON Schema
item.atom:content: The Azure Event Hubs Schema Registry provides support for JSON Schema

item.title: Generally Available – New Azure Event Grid events for Azure API Management Self-hosted gateway
item.description: We are announcing the support for 11 new Azure Event Grid event types in Azure API Management.
item.atom:content: We are announcing the support for 11 new Azure Event Grid event types in Azure API Management.

item.title: Generally available: Kafka Connect support in Azure Event Hubs
item.description: With Kafka Connect support GA, users can seamlessly and reliably stream data between Azure Event Hubs and external systems such as databases, key-value stores, file systems and other data sources.
item.atom:content: With Kafka Connect support GA, users can seamlessly and reliably stream data between Azure Event Hubs and external systems such as databases, key-value stores, file systems and other data sources.

item.title: Generally Available – Custom domain support for self-hosted gateway configuration endpoint v2
item.description: We are announcing the support of custom domain for the self-hosted gateway configuration endpoint v2.
item.atom:content: We are announcing the support of custom domain for the self-hosted gateway configuration endpoint v2.

item.title: GA Azure API Management Self-hosted gateway authentication using Azure Active Directory
item.description: New authentication method for the Self-hosted gateway with the configuration endpoint
item.atom:content: New authentication method for the Self-hosted gateway with the configuration endpoint

item.title: Generally available: Managed Identities support for Capture in Event Hubs
item.description: Users now can use managed identities when capturing event streams to storage services such as Azure Storage Services or Azure Data Lake storage 2.
item.atom:content: Users now can use managed identities when capturing event streams to storage services such as Azure Storage Services or Azure Data Lake storage 2.

item.title: Generally available: Kafka compaction support in Azure Event Hubs
item.description: Log compaction in Event Hubs introduces a key-based retention mechanism where the most recent value associated with each event key in an event hub or Kafka topic is retained.
item.atom:content: Log compaction in Event Hubs introduces a key-based retention mechanism where the most recent value associated with each event key in an event hub or Kafka topic is retained.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure Files geo-redundancy for standard large file shares
item.description: Azure Files geo-redundancy for large file shares is now in public preview for standard SMB file shares.
item.atom:content: Azure Files geo-redundancy for large file shares is now in public preview for standard SMB file shares.

item.title: Generally Available: Exactly Once Delivery to ADLS Gen2 Output
item.description: Azure Stream Analytics supports for end-to-end exactly once semantics when writing to Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2.
item.atom:content: Azure Stream Analytics supports for end-to-end exactly once semantics when writing to Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure AI Content Safety
item.description: Azure AI Content Safety is a new Azure AI service that identifies harmful online content, categorizes it and assigns severity scores to support human content moderator workloads.
item.atom:content: Azure AI Content Safety is a new Azure AI service that identifies harmful online content, categorizes it and assigns severity scores to support human content moderator workloads.

item.title: Private Preview: Kafka Input and Output with Azure Stream Analytics
item.description: You can connect directly to Kafka to ingest from Kafka clusters or output data to Kafka clusters in your Azure Stream Analytics (ASA) job.
item.atom:content: You can connect directly to Kafka to ingest from Kafka clusters or output data to Kafka clusters in your Azure Stream Analytics (ASA) job.

item.title: Virtual Network Integration Support (Public Preview) for Azure Stream Analytics

item.atom:content: ASA is thrilled to announce public preview of Virtual Network Integration support for Azure Stream Analytics!

item.title: Azure Stream Analytics is Launching a New Competitive Pricing Model!
item.description: Up to 80% price reduction in Azure Stream Analytics
item.atom:content: Up to 80% price reduction in Azure Stream Analytics

item.title: Public preview: Soft delete of Recovery Points for Azure Backup
item.description: Azure Backup's soft delete of recovery points allows you to recover any recovery points that may have been accidentally or maliciously deleted owing to operations that could lead to deletion of one or more recovery points.
item.atom:content: Azure Backup's soft delete of recovery points allows you to recover any recovery points that may have been accidentally or maliciously deleted owing to operations that could lead to deletion of one or more recovery points.

item.title: Generally Available: Exactly Once Delivery to Event Hub Output

item.atom:content: Stream Analytics now supports end-to-end exactly once semantics when writing to Event Hub output.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure Cosmos DB SDKs OpenTelemetry and Application Insights integration

item.atom:content: Monitoring your applications is easier than ever with new support for OpenTelemetry and improved Application Insights integration.

item.title: Public Preview: Dynamic Blob container name

item.atom:content: Azure Stream Analytics offers dynamic blob container name to give customers the flexibility to customize container names in Blob storage output.

item.description: Azure Stream Analytics can now fetch schema from the Schema Registry and deserialize data from Event Hub inputs for Avro format.
item.atom:content: Azure Stream Analytics can now fetch schema from the Schema Registry and deserialize data from Event Hub inputs for Avro format.

item.title: Public Preview: App Service automatic scaling support in portal UX

item.atom:content: The new Network Observability AKS add-on provides complete observability into the network health and connectivity of your AKS cluster.

item.title: Preview: Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) 9.2 support for AMD confidential VMs

item.atom:content: User of AMD-based confidential VMs can now select the RHEL 9.2 technical preview as their guest OS.

item.atom:content: Users can now run their most sensitive data workloads in ADX clusters on AMD-based confidential VM SKUs.

item.title: Build 2023: New Azure App Service plans fuel greater choice and savings

item.atom:content: New plans for Microsoft Azure App Service customers with two new offerings in the Premium v3 (Pv3) service tier, and expansion in the Isolated v2 tier.

item.title: Azure Key Vault Access Configuration Update

item.title: Database Migration Assessment for Oracle - GA

item.atom:content: Database Migration Assessment for Oracle extension analyzes an organization's Oracle database, identifying performance requirements and code compatibility with the target Azure database for a smooth migration.

item.atom:content: Rewind to read previous transactions in Synapse Link containers to analyze previous versions of your document with time-travel for Azure Synapse Link

item.title: Available: Azure Database for MySQL connector for Power Platform and Azure Logic Apps

item.atom:content: Azure Database for MySQL connector for Power Platform, Azure Logic Apps is now available and allows you to connect to any MySQL Flexible Server database to read and write data.

item.atom:content: ACI now lets you run containers in a trusted execution environment (TEE)

item.atom:content: Optimize costs on your Log Analytics workspace by adding transformation rules to your Cosmos DB LA tables.

item.atom:content: Public preview enhancements and updates released for Azure SQL in late-May 2023

item.title: Microsoft Azure Deployment Environments is now generally available.

item.atom:content: Azure Deployment Environments is now generally available. With Deployment Environments, developers can self-deploy the environments they need on demand using infrastructure-as-code templates.

item.title: Public preview: Automated deployments in AKS now supports Draft

item.title: Public Preview: Vector search in Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB vCore
item.description: Vector search in Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB vCore enhances AI-driven applications using OpenAI API or custom-built solutions by incorporating vector similarity search into your database.
item.atom:content: Vector search in Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB vCore enhances AI-driven applications using OpenAI API or custom-built solutions by incorporating vector similarity search into your database.

item.atom:content: An extension that automates and provides code conversion from Oracle to SQL to simplify and accelerate the migration process.

item.atom:content: Seamless data migration from Oracle to Azure with the new Azure Database Migration Service extension

item.title: Generally Available: Azure Cosmos DB serverless container with 1 TB storage

item.atom:content: Azure Cosmos DB serverless 1-TB is now generally available. Enjoy expanded storage capacity, allowing you to store up to 1 TB of data in a single container.

item.title: Generally Available: Azure Cosmos DB hierarchical partition keys

item.atom:content: Now generally available, hierarchical partition keys in Azure Cosmos DB enables you to partition your data with up to three levels of keys.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure Cosmos DB all versions and deletes change feed mode
item.description: The new all versions and deletes mode for change feed allows you to read item creates, updates, and deletes that occurred within the continuous backup period configured on your account.
item.atom:content: The new all versions and deletes mode for change feed allows you to read item creates, updates, and deletes that occurred within the continuous backup period configured on your account.

item.title: Public Preview: Materialized views for Cosmos DB NoSQL API

item.atom:content: Create materialized views on top of your NoSQL containers to reduce cross partition queries, improve speed, and reduce costs.

item.title: Public preview: Azure Monitor managed service for Prometheus for Azure Arc-enabled Kubernetes

item.atom:content: Azure Monitor managed service for Prometheus is now extending monitoring support for Kubernetes clusters hosted on Azure Arc.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure Monitor Container insights introduces "Cluster Optimization" workbook
item.description: Customers can now use Azure Monitor Container insights “Cluster Optimization” workbook to optimize container limits and request, identify event anomalies and detect liveness probe failures.
item.atom:content: Customers can now use Azure Monitor Container insights “Cluster Optimization” workbook to optimize container limits and request, identify event anomalies and detect liveness probe failures.

item.title: Generally Available: Azure Monitor announces managed services for Prometheus
item.description: Azure Monitor managed service for Prometheus delivers the best of the open-source ecosystem while automating complex tasks such as scaling, high-availability, and long-term data retention.
item.atom:content: Azure Monitor managed service for Prometheus delivers the best of the open-source ecosystem while automating complex tasks such as scaling, high-availability, and long-term data retention.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure Log Alerts support for Azure Data Explorer
item.description: Azure Monitor Log Alerts is expanding to support monitoring based on data that stored in Azure Data Explorer (ADX) tables, empowering customers to leverage ADX without compromising their service monitoring.
item.atom:content: Azure Monitor Log Alerts is expanding to support monitoring based on data that stored in Azure Data Explorer (ADX) tables, empowering customers to leverage ADX without compromising their service monitoring.

item.title: Generally Available: Linked backends for Azure Static Web Apps

item.atom:content: You can now link your backend APIs to your Static Web Apps applications for seamless routing and integrated security.

item.title: Public preview: Azure Functions for cloud-native microservices
item.description: Quickly build event driven, cloud native apps, with the flexibility to run functions along with other microservices, APIs, websites, workflows or any container hosted programs.
item.atom:content: Quickly build event driven, cloud native apps, with the flexibility to run functions along with other microservices, APIs, websites, workflows or any container hosted programs.

item.title: Generally Available: SQL Bindings for Azure Functions
item.description: With input and output bindings for SQL, you can now can quickly write Azure Functions that read and write from your databases.
item.atom:content: With input and output bindings for SQL, you can now can quickly write Azure Functions that read and write from your databases.

item.title: Public preview: ASP.NET Core integration in Azure Functions .NET isolated model
item.description: Use familiar ASP.NET Core types to construct HTTP-triggered functions in the isolated worker model.
item.atom:content: Use familiar ASP.NET Core types to construct HTTP-triggered functions in the isolated worker model.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure Event Grid now includes MQTT protocol support and HTTP pull-style message delivery.
item.description: Publish and subscribe to messages between MQTT clients and use HTTP push and pull subscriptions to integrate data with other applications.
item.atom:content: Publish and subscribe to messages between MQTT clients and use HTTP push and pull subscriptions to integrate data with other applications.

item.title: New capabilities available in Microsoft Dev Box
item.description: Microsoft Dev Box is introducing several new capabilities to enhance developer experience and boost productivity. In addition, Dev Box general availability will begin in July.
item.atom:content: Microsoft Dev Box is introducing several new capabilities to enhance developer experience and boost productivity. In addition, Dev Box general availability will begin in July.

item.title: Public Preview: GitHub Advanced Security for Azure DevOps
item.description: Learn how GitHub Advanced Security for Azure DevOps implements code scanning, secret scanning, and dependency scanning in Azure DevOps.
item.atom:content: Learn how GitHub Advanced Security for Azure DevOps implements code scanning, secret scanning, and dependency scanning in Azure DevOps.

item.title: Public preview: Secrets volume mounts for Azure Container Apps
item.description: You can now mount secrets as volumes in Azure Container Apps.
item.atom:content: You can now mount secrets as volumes in Azure Container Apps.

item.title: Public preview: Free managed TLS certificates for Azure Container Apps
item.description: You can now use managed certificates with Azure Container Apps
item.atom:content: You can now use managed certificates with Azure Container Apps

item.title: Public preview: Serverlessly run on-demand, scheduled, and event-driven jobs on Azure Container Apps
item.description: Run workloads that perform a task for a finite duration and exit, and schedule these workloads or run them in response to events.
item.atom:content: Run workloads that perform a task for a finite duration and exit, and schedule these workloads or run them in response to events.

item.title: AKS DevX Extension Updates for Visual Studio Code
item.description: Easily create and deploy GitHub Actions to automate your deployments.
item.atom:content: Easily create and deploy GitHub Actions to automate your deployments.

item.title: Public preview: Multi-cluster update support in Azure Kubernetes Fleet Manager
item.description: Orchestrate upgrades to your clusters in a planned manner across multiple clusters to achieve a consistent environment across a set of clusters.
item.atom:content: Orchestrate upgrades to your clusters in a planned manner across multiple clusters to achieve a consistent environment across a set of clusters.

item.title: Public preview: Custom node config for Windows
item.description: You can now modify the node configuration on Windows nodes, as you do with Linux.
item.atom:content: You can now modify the node configuration on Windows nodes, as you do with Linux.

item.title: Generally Available: Kubernetes marketplace
item.description: Access to a vibrant ecosystem of first-party and third-party solutions for building robust enterprise solutions.
item.atom:content: Access to a vibrant ecosystem of first-party and third-party solutions for building robust enterprise solutions.
